node.title: Rent or live in an apartment? Here's how you can reap the benefits of solar
node.alt: Worker installs solar panels on a flat roof
node.description: One-third of households are locked out of installing solar panels on their rooftop. Is buying a "plot" in a community "solar garden" a way to access cheaper renewable energy and lower your power bills?
node.content:
["When Ash asked his property manager to pass on a request to\u00a0the landlord\u00a0to install solar panels at his Sydney rental, he knew it was a shot in the dark and probably going to fail.", "Why would the\u00a0landlord pay for the panels if Ash, a tenant\u00a0he'd never met, would reap the\u00a0lower power bills?", "\"It wasn't the most enticing offer,\" Ash said.", "\"The property manager said thanks for the idea, but the\u00a0landlord is not ready for it.\"", "", "
Ash has signed up to a new kind of \"solar garden\" project being developed in NSW.(Supplied: Ash)
", "Australia has an exceptionally high uptake of rooftop solar, but for millions of households, installing panels is not an option, even when they can afford them.", "They're either\u00a0renting,\u00a0living in an apartment, or their roof is too\u00a0shaded.", "All up, a whopping one-third of all households are unable to directly participate in the switch to renewables \u2014\u00a0meaning they're locked out of saving\u00a0money through cheaper power bills.", "The most vulnerable, low-income electricity users fall into this category.", "One proposed solution to this is community solar energy gardens, where households can invest in a \"plot\" in a solar array elsewhere, and then get credits on their electricity bill.", "The latest national Energy Consumer Sentiment Survey, commissioned by\u00a0Energy Consumers' Australia (ECA), suggests the idea is growing in popularity, with almost three-quarters of family households interested in buying power from a local community solar garden.\u00a0\u00a0", "But despite the idea being around for some time, and popular in the US, Australia has only one tiny\u00a0solar garden.", "So what are solar gardens, and why has the idea been slow to catch on?", "
How do solar gardens work?
", "Australia's first and only solar garden is a 35kW solar array situated on the roof of the North Coast Community Housing\u00a0(NCCH) building,\u00a0a social housing provider in Lismore, NSW.", "", "
Solar panels being installed on the NCCH building in\u00a0Lismore.(Supplied: Enova Energy)
", "The NCCH pays Enova Energy, a local community-owned retailer,\u00a0for any electricity it uses from the array.", "The money generated by that purchase is converted to electricity bill credits and\u00a0divided between 24 \"solar gardeners\", who are a mix of local community groups and\u00a0NCCH social housing\u00a0tenants.", "\"We've provided $1,000 in bill credits to four community organisations in the 2021 financial year and tenants have been provided around $4,500 in credits on energy bills,\"\u00a0said Felicity Stening, Enova's managing director.", "", "
Solar gardens allow\u00a0more households to access cheaper renewable energy.(Supplied: ARENA)
", "A second, much larger\u00a0solar garden\u00a0planned to be built in\u00a0the\u00a0Riverina region of NSW is taking a different approach.", "The Haystacks Solar Garden\u00a0will be a\u00a0collection of 330 3kW plots totalling 1MW.", "Customers, who can be anywhere in NSW, will pay\u00a0about $4,200 to own a plot and receive\u00a0credits on their electricity bills.", "The project is in the final stages of getting financial approvals and grid connections completed, says Kristy Walters from the Community Power Agency, which is a partner in the project.", "\"We're hoping to go ahead and start construction next year,\" she said.", "
Australians 'thinking about solar in new ways'
", "Though solar gardens have been slow to catch on compared to privately-owned rooftop panels, there's evidence of growing public interest in community-owned energy generation and storage.", "Most people responding to the\u00a0Energy Consumer Sentiment Survey\u00a0said it was unfair renters and those living in apartments\u00a0could not access solar.", "A sizeable majority backed the government\u00a0installing solar and batteries in community housing\u00a0and incentivising landlords and apartment complex owners to do the same.", "Almost half of households said initiatives such as solar gardens should be supported by government investment.", "This points to a change in the way many\u00a0Australians are thinking about solar and energy in general,\u00a0ECA\u00a0chief executive officer Lynne Gallagher said.", "", "
Solar rebates, cheap power,\u00a0and the lure of energy independence has driven uptake of rooftop PV.(ABC News)
", "Previous surveys have shown that values of independence and self-sufficiency motivate people to get solar panels.", "This survey suggests there's emerging interest in a more community-oriented way of looking at energy\u00a0\u2014\u00a0something to share and a way to help\u00a0neighbours and take part in a common enterprise.", "\"The rise of rooftop solar in Australia has been a world-leading success. But we know the benefits have not been equally available to all,\" said Ms Gallagher, whose organisation represents residential owners and small businesses.", "
Extending solar subsidies to renters, apartment-dwellers
", "Earlier this month, Labor unveiled a climate plan that includes a proposal for dozens of \"solar banks\" \u2014\u00a0another name for solar gardens.", "Under the plan, a Labor government would invest $100 million to support the creation of 85 solar gardens, which Labor says could allow more than 25,000 households to share in the benefits of solar power.", "The funding would\u00a0subsidise\u00a0up to 50 per cent of the capital cost of a project.", "", "
The Haystacks Solar Garden will be located on a property in Grong Grong in the Riverina region of NSW.(Supplied: Community Power Agency)
", "A 2018 feasibility study part-funded by the\u00a0Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) also proposed a capital subsidy of 50 per cent to make solar gardens financially viable.", "This would work out to about $2,400-$4,200 per household, the report said.", "Its lead author,\u00a0Jay Rutovitz from the University of Technology Sydney,\u00a0pointed out that households have been enjoying generous government subsidies for years, in the form of solar panel rebates.", "Subsidising solar gardens would\u00a0extend this welfare to a further third of households.", "\"There's also a strong equity argument for making solar available to people for\u00a0whom it's\u00a0not been available to,\" Ms Rutovitz said.", "
Should community energy pay full network costs?
", "But Ms Rutovitz,\u00a0who is the research director with the Institute for Sustainable Futures at UTS, added that\u00a0subsidies did not go far enough and it was\u00a0necessary to\u00a0reform the electricity system.", "She\u00a0proposed that energy customers who got\u00a0their power\u00a0from a nearby community-owned solar array should not have to pay as much for transmission as an energy customer\u00a0who got their power from further away and relied\u00a0on costly long-distance transmission.", "\"We need to have some kind of local network tariff for community solar and community batteries as well,\" Ms Rutovitz said.", "Network charges, aka the cost of delivering power,\u00a0make\u00a0up a large proportion of a standard\u00a0electricity bill.", "In the US, solar gardens don't have to pay this cost, and there is now\u00a03.4 gigawatts of installed community solar across 41 states.", "\"In Australia, we gave subsidies to put solar on the roof, while in the US\u00a0they said that for anyone that sets up a solar farm, the consumer is not to be charged network charges,\" Ms Rutovitz said.", "Enova Energy's Ms Stening said government funding was needed to \"get these projects off the ground\".", "The Haystacks project is supported by a grant from the NSW government.", "", "
Kristy Walters (centre) with the Haystacks project team\u00a0and children.(Supplied: Community Power Agency)
", "Ms Walters from the Community Power Agency said the financial rewards of solar gardens would never be as good as having a rooftop solar system, but they were better than no solar savings at all.", "Ash, who's still renting in Sydney and\u00a0remains locked out of access to solar, has signed up to the Haystacks project.", "He hopes to soon buy a plot in the array.", "\"This is a no-brainer,\" he said.", "\"Renters and tenants get a really shit experience.\u00a0I don't have any power in this whole landlord game play.", "\"But this is a tangible thing I can invest in.\""]
